## Step 1: Load Required Libraries
```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
```
## Step 2: Import Dataset
```{r}
data("mtcars")
df <- mtcars

# Convert some numeric columns to categorical for analysis
df$cyl <- as.factor(df$cyl)
df$gear <- as.factor(df$gear)
df$carb <- as.factor(df$carb)

head(df)

```

## Step 3: Descriptive Statistics
```{r}
# Quantitative summaries
summary(select(df, mpg, hp, wt, qsec))

# Frequency tables for categorical variables
table(df$cyl)
table(df$gear)
table(df$carb)
```

## Step 4: Variable Transformation
```{r}
df$log_hp <- log(df$hp)

head(select(df, hp, log_hp))
```

## Step 5: Visualization
Histogram of a Quantitative Variable
```{r}
ggplot(df, aes(x = mpg)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 2, fill = "steelblue", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Histogram of Miles per Gallon (mpg)",
       x = "Miles per Gallon",
       y = "Count")

```

Scatterplot of Two Quantitative Variables
```{r}
ggplot(df, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = cyl)) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  labs(title = "Scatterplot of Weight vs MPG by Cylinders",
       x = "Car Weight (1000 lbs)",
       y = "Miles per Gallon") +
  theme_minimal()

```
